page.title: 03LIFEBOAT-PORTPATRICK
page.content: {"The Jeanie,"}is a{Watson {Cabin Lifeboat,}with twin 60 H.P. diesel engines giving a range of{160 {miles}cruising at{9 knots,}covering an area to the{mid-point}of the{North {Channel,}from{Milleur Point}in the north to the{Isle of Man}in the south. The crew consists of a full-time Coxwain-Mechanic and Second Coxswain, with twelve other volunteer members including an aircraft fitter, car mechanic,farmworker,joiner and schoolteacher. Normally{7 men}man the boat on{ call-out,being called on service twice per month,on average,in the last year. The boat,which lies at moorings in the inner harbour,{launches for {training most Sunday afternoons.}Joint training is undertaken,at intervals, with the{Coastguard,rescue helicopters {from R.N. and R.A.F.and Stranraer ILB.
